title: sCAD patient, C-01
growth_protocol_ch1: Citrate anti-coagulated blood samples (50 mL) were taken from each subject and collected in vacutainers (BD Vacutainer, Becton Dickinson, San Diego, CA) at a final sodium citrate concentration of 3.8%. The blood samples were centrifuged at 160 g for 20 minutes at room temperature in order to obtain platelet-rich plasma, and the platelets were then purified by immunomagnetic negative selection using magnetic beads coated with anti-CD45 antibodies (DynabeadsH, Invitrogen, Carlsbad, CA) to deplete the nucleated cells. The purified platelets were washed three times in PBS/BSA solution, counted, and tested for purity. Finally, the purified platelets were treated with an appropriate amount of TRIzolTM (Invitrogen) for cell lysis and RNA cryopreservation.
extract_protocol_ch1: RNA was extracted by TRIzolTM (Invitrogen) in accordance with the manufacturerâ€™s protocol.
label_protocol_ch1: biotin-labelled cDNA (from 10 ng of RNA) was synthesised using the GeneChip WT Pico kit (Affymetrix, Santa Clara, CA).
hyb_protocol: Affymetrix gene chips, Human Transcriptome Array 2.0 (Affymetrix, Santa Clara, CA), were hybridized with 5 Î¼g fragmented and biotin-labeled cDNA in 200 Î¼l of hybridization cocktail. Target denaturation was performed at 99Â°C for 5 min. and then 45Â°C for 5 min, followed by hybridization with rotation 60 rpm for 16 hour at 45Â°C. Arrays were then washed and stained using Gene chip Fluidic Station 450, using Affymetrix GeneChip hybridization wash & stain kit.
scan_protocol: Chips were scanned on an Affymetrix Gene Chip Scanner 3000, using Command Console Software.
description: gene expression data from platelet of patient stable coronary artery disease (sCAD)
data_processing: Raw data were processed  by Affymetrix Expression Console software (v. 1.4.1) with the default parameters.  The SST-RMA normalization method was applied.
